episodes.title: Does the NKT break up Families?
episodes.description: How might being an active member of the NKT put your personal relationships at risk, and why do so many abandonments, break-ups, and disfunctionalities occur in the lives of those who are closely involved in the organization? In this video, I try to look at the various dynamics and contents in the NKT that might lead to a person neglecting, alienating from, or even abandoning their family and others in their lives. For the BBC report on this issue, click here 👉 https://www.facebook.com/share/v/19r9v3icsz/

episodes.title: How Michael lost money and faith in the NKT
episodes.description: Michael was ordained in the NKT and helped set up a center in Santa Fe, New Mexico. When things didn't go as planned, he was left alone to pick up the pieces, which led to financial ruin, as no help or even any moral support came from the NKT management.

episodes.title: The Money Book of the NKT
episodes.description: The Money Book, which is a set  of guidelines for  NKT entities as to how to handle their income, provides a really interesting perspective  on how the NKT operates and what its actual aims are, which can be reduced to just two words: building temples. I personally don't quite get the NKT's obsession with temples, but the question, in any case, arises: do temples help people actually find the buddhadharma to the extent that they're worth all the money and sacrifice of private individuals, and if they are, how come Buddha Shakyamuni didn't build them? Or is it more about the NKT's megalomania and narcissistic hunger of power and exhibitionism?   The link to the Money Book is here  👉https://www.facebook.com/share/p/1AmW8ZmZnE/

episodes.title: The Dirty Dozen - 12 issues that make the NKT better to avoid
episodes.description: Twelve issues that make the NKT a potentially dangerous, high control, sectarian cult

episodes.title: How the NKT (New Kadampa Tradition) extorted Manjushri from its owners -The Blackmail Tape
episodes.description: Few people in the NKT are aware how the mother center, Manjushri, came to pass into the NKT ownership.  The curretly defunct New Kadampa Truth website explained it as thanks to a "legal loophole." But it was actually much more sinister than that.  For the story and the transcript of the blackmail tape, as well as comments that try to shed light other aspects of the story, see Tenzin's blog, https://buddhism-controversy-blog.com/2010/07/14/good-night-lama-the-blackmail-tape/.  This video contains some of these facts, my  interpretation of them, and my own reaction to this information and the effect it had on me while I was still involved in the NKT.

episodes.title: What to do with active NKT members who flood our channel with comments?
episodes.description: There have been quite a few comments on this channel by active NKT members condemning the content, and, in response,  by some survivors who call for taking action against them by banning them from the channel and deleting their comments.  This is my view on this issue. (Severely abusive or vulgar comments ARE deleted).

episodes.title: Christian's experience of the New Kadampa Tradition
episodes.description: Christian Ashcraft was one of the early members of the Spanish NKT sangha in the mid-1990s. This is his story.

episodes.title: Survivors of the New Kadampa Tradition- who are they? Part 2    The NKT point of view
episodes.description:
This is part 2 of my two part series on the survivors of the NKT where I present the common NKT point of view and also talk about  - following Matthew Remski - how the mechanism of  "i got mine" works.

if you have a survivor story or a relevant thing to say and do not want to share it publicly,  you can send an email to exposingthenewkadampatradition@gmail.com

episodes.title: Survivors of the New Kadampa Tradition. Who are they? Part 1
episodes.description:
This is Part 1 of a two-part video regarding what it means to be a survivor, and why ex members of the NKT are often referred to as 'survivors'.  

also check.out the following website mentioned in the video, it's very useful:

https://cultrecovery101.com/cult-recovery-readings/checklist-of-cult-characteristics/

episodes.title: Linda's story
episodes.description: Linda was a member in the NKT 's early days. Many years after she left she was instrumental in organizing counter demos during the NKT demonstrations against the Dalai Lama.

episodes.title: I was a nun in the NKT.  Andrea's story
episodes.description:
Andrea was an ordained member of the NKT for about 5 years. She used to live in Manjushri, the mother center, and also met Kelsang Gyatso. The part of her account where she describes their encounter pretty much sums up for me the utter hypocrisy of the man himself and the organization he created. 

#geshekelsanggyatso 
#cults
#newkadampatradition 
#kadampabuddhism

episodes.title: Zoe's experience with the New Kadampa Tradition
episodes.description: Zoe was part of the NKT for about ten years. S #newkadampatradition #geshekelsanggyatso #cult #nkt #lovebombing he gives lots of valuable insights into how the NKT works. if there's one thing she said here that I will never forget is that doing what makes us happy is necessary for our health.  Among lots of other things, we talk about how renunciation and self-cherishing are interpreted in the NKT and she also has some good advice to both those who are stuck inside and are afraid to leave and those who are thinking of joining the NKT.

episodes.title: Cult-speak in the New Kadampa Tradition or: the language that binds
episodes.description: In this video I examine some of the key phrases the NKT uses in its general discourse in its centers, online content, and "teachings." nased on the seminal work of Robert Jay Lifton I've developed the  thesis that, just like any other totalitarian system, the NKT uses jargon that creates a cohesive force between the members and the cult,  keeps them invested, obedient, and ready to defend their way of thinking to anyone who questions them.  Through repetition, these words and phrases ingrain an intense emotional association in the group members' psyche and shut down arguments and critical thinking to the extent that, after a period of time,  the cult member ends up brainwashing themself.

episodes.title: I was a monk in the NKT - Renato's story Part 2
episodes.description: this is part 2 of Renato's story who was a monk and teacher in the NKT for a number of years.

episodes.title: first red flags you've joined a cult such as the New Kadampa Tradition
episodes.description:
What are the early signs that you are joining a high pressure /coercive group aka cult such as the #newkadampatradition? this video aims  to explain what they are.  the early red flags that you may be involved in a cult also include:

1. Pressure to isolate yourself from friends and family outside of the group.
2. Requirement to contribute excessive amounts of time and money to the group.
3. Leadership that is authoritarian and not open to questions or criticism.
4. Belief that the group is the only path to salvation, enlightenment, etc.
5. Use of mind-control techniques such as manipulation, gaslighting, or coercion.

Signs that may come later and indicate you are in a cult include:

1. Feeling dependent on the group for your identity and sense of self-worth.
2. Experiencing fear or anxiety about leaving the group or questioning its beliefs.
3. Witnessing or experiencing abuse within the group that is justified or ignored by leaders.
4. Observing a pattern of broken promises or failed prophecies by the group leaders.
5. Realizing that critical thinking and individuality are discouraged or punished within the group. 

If you have concerns about a particular group or organization you are involved with, it is important to reach out to trusted friends, family members, or mental health professionals for support and guidance.

Geshela said!!
episodes.description:
when you're in the NKT you hear "Geshela said" about a hundred times a day.  while he was alive it's was, "Geshela says".  this is a funny video by Luke how that feels. 
#newkadampatradition #geshekelsanggyatso #geshelasaid

episodes.title: Isolation and coercion in the New Kadampa Tradition
episodes.description:
please check out my first video on how the NKT hooks its new members https://youtu.be/V8iDFrxBEIY?si=CkN1z679JlS8D1Jb. 

In this video I talk about my experience of how the group tends to isolate its members from the outside world and pressure them to give more to the organization "to help all living beings without exception"

episodes.title: Love bombing in the New Kadampa Tradition  (NKT)
episodes.description: Neil Elliot aka Gen Thubten described pretty well the process by which the NKT hooks new members in, it is what is known as #lovebombing, ie  showering unconditional and instant love and affection on the new member. Very few people can sta unaffected by love bombing, almost everyone is susceptible, some more,  others less. But the honeymoon won't last long and serves to manipulate individuals into developing attachment,  loyalty and servitude to the group.
